metadata.title: CVE-2009-1183 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
The JBIG2 MMR decoder in Xpdf 3.02pl2 and earlier, CUPS 1.3.9 and earlier, Poppler before 0.10.6, and other products allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop and hang) via a crafted PDF file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-1183` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler123 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
poppler-utils - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.note: jdstrand> CUPS on Ubuntu uses system pdftops (compiled with --disable-pdftops)

criterions.comment: poppler package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.5-1ubuntu2').
